definition: strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
breath/news/interest (on an investment or loan)/to cease/to stop/to rest/Taiwan pr. [xi2]

sentences.english: To de fend our country we must strengthen ourselves.
sentences.chinese: 爲了保衛祖國，我們必須自強不息。

sentences.english: However, Yan Yuan's distinct character was continuous self-renewal to perfect virtues.
sentences.chinese: 然而顏淵之本色，在自強不息以進德。

sentences.english: The Asian people have an unyielding national spirit and great creativity.
sentences.chinese: 亞洲人民有着自強不息的民族精神和傑出的創造力。

sentences.english: The running Hanjiang River water has cultivated the Xiantao people's unremitting self-improvement spirit.
sentences.chinese: 奔騰不息的漢江水，孕育了仙桃人自強不息的精神。
天行健，君子當自強不息。

sentences.english: The Chinese civilization has always given prominence to unremitting self-improvement, reform and innovation.
sentences.chinese: 中華文明歷來注重自強不息，不斷革故鼎新。

definition: to bear hardships and work hard (idiom); assiduous and long-suffering/hard-working and capable of overcoming adversity
to rouse to vigorous action/energetic mood
to develop/to make full use of
to follow the past and herald the future (idiom); part of a historical transition/forming a bridge between earlier and later stages
